abstract: Motorola shares got a modest bounce from their lows on Wednesday after The Wall Street Journal reported that the company was seeking buyers for its home and networks mobility division.
snippet: Motorola shares got a modest bounce from their lows on Wednesday after The Wall Street Journal reported that the company was seeking buyers for its home and networks mobility division.
lead_paragraph: Update | 2:30 p.m. DealBook has confirmed that Motorola has hired JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs to explore a sale of its home and networks mobility division, according to people briefed on the matter. Several private equity firms have been approached, but the process is in the early stages, these people said.

headline.main: Motorola Is Seeking Buyers for Mobility Unit
